name: Clobetasol Propionate
indications: clobetasol propionate cream , 0.05 % ( emollient ) super-high potency corticosteroid indicated :
contraindications: apply thin layer clobetasol propionate cream , 0.05 % ( emollient ) affected skin areas twice daily rub gently completely . wash hands application . clobetasol propionate cream , 0.05 % ( emollient ) super-high potency topical corticosteroid ; therefore , treatment limited 2 consecutive weeks , amounts greater 50 grams per week used . moderate severe plaque-type psoriasis , clobetasol propionate cream , 0.05 % ( emollient ) applied 5 % 10 % body surface area used 4 weeks . total exceed 50 grams per week . dosing 2 weeks , additional benefits extending treatment weighed risk hpa suppression . therapy discontinued control achieved . improvement seen within 2 weeks , reassessment diagnosis may necessary . treatment beyond 4 consecutive weeks recommended . clobetasol propionate cream , 0.05 % ( emollient ) used occlusive dressings .
warningsAndPrecautions: supplied clobetasol propionate cream usp , 0.05 % ( emollient ) white off-white cream , supplied 15 g ( ndc 51672-1297-1 ) , 30 g ( ndc 51672-1297-2 ) 60 g tubes ( ndc 51672-1297-3 ) .
indications_original: Clobetasol propionate cream, 0.05% (emollient) is a super-high potency corticosteroid indicated for:
contraindications_original:
Apply a thin layer of clobetasol propionate cream, 0.05% (emollient) to the affected skin areas twice daily and rub in gently and completely. Wash hands after each application.
                  Clobetasol propionate cream, 0.05% (emollient) is a super-high potency topical corticosteroid; therefore,
 
  treatment should be limited to 2 consecutive weeks, and amounts greater than 50 grams per week should not be used.
                  
                  In moderate to severe plaque-type psoriasis, clobetasol propionate cream, 0.05% (emollient) applied to 5% to 10% of body surface area can be used for up to 4 weeks. The total dosage should not exceed 50 grams per week. When dosing for more than 2 weeks, any additional benefits of extending treatment should be weighed against the risk of HPA suppression. Therapy should be discontinued when control has been achieved. If no improvement is seen within 2 weeks, reassessment of diagnosis may be necessary. Treatment beyond 4 consecutive weeks is not recommended.
                  Clobetasol propionate cream, 0.05% (emollient) should not be used with occlusive dressings.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
How Supplied
                        
                        Clobetasol Propionate Cream USP, 0.05% (Emollient) is a white to off-white cream, supplied in 15 g (NDC 51672-1297-1), 30 g (NDC 51672-1297-2) and 60 g tubes (NDC 51672-1297-3).
